installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# Spigot Installation Script
#
# Server Files: /mnt/server

apt update 
apt install -y curl wget git openssl bash bc apt-transport-https gnupg software-properties-common
wget -qO - https://adoptopenjdk.jfrog.io/adoptopenjdk/api/gpg/key/public | apt-key add -
add-apt-repository --yes https://adoptopenjdk.jfrog.io/adoptopenjdk/deb/
apt update
mkdir -p /usr/share/man/man1
if [ "${DL_VERSION}" == "latest" ] || (( $(echo "${DL_VERSION} >= 1.17" | bc -l) )); then
    apt install -y adoptopenjdk-16-hotspot
else
    apt install -y adoptopenjdk-8-hotspot
fi

## Only download if a path is provided, otherwise continue.
if [ ! -z "${DL_PATH}" ]; then
    cd /mnt/server

    MODIFIED_DOWNLOAD=`eval echo $(echo ${DL_PATH} | sed -e 's/{{/${/g' -e 's/}}/}/g')`
    curl -sSL -o ${SERVER_JARFILE} ${MODIFIED_DOWNLOAD}
else
    mkdir -p /srv/
    cd /srv/
    
    wget https://hub.spigotmc.org/jenkins/job/BuildTools/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/target/BuildTools.jar
    
    java -jar BuildTools.jar --rev ${DL_VERSION}

    mv spigot-*.jar /mnt/server/${SERVER_JARFILE}
fi

variables.description: The name of the server jarfile to run the server with.

variables.name: Download Path
variables.description: A URL to use to download Spigot rather than building it on the server. This is not user viewable. Use {{DL_VERSION}} in the URL to automatically insert the assigned version into the URL. If you do not enter a URL Spigot will build directly in the container (this will fail on low memory containers).

variables.name: Spigot Version
variables.description: The version of Spigot to download (using the --rev tag). Use "latest" for latest.
